Header: Boeing pledges 100 mln USD to help families of 737 Max crash victims in Indonesia, Ethiopia
Content: The Boeing Company announced Wednesday that it has set aside 100 million U.S. dollars for addressing family and community needs of those affected by two deadly air crashes in Indonesia and Ethiopia in October last year and in March this year. Boeing said the funds are an initial investment to be paid over a number of years to support education, hardship and living expenses of the families of the victims who were killed in the “tragic accidents” of Indonesian Lion Air Flight 610 and the Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302. The two air crashes, both involving Boeing 737 Max 8 jets, killed 346 people in total and led to the global grounding of the 737 Max aircraft since the beginning of March. Boeing chairman, president and CEO Dennis Muilenburg expressed “deepest sympathies” for the families of those victims, hoping the funds will “help bring them comfort.
